scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents note
scopecontent.p: Records relating to the Brooklyn Society of the New Church's purchase of property at Clark and Monroe Streets, including subscription lists, minutes, mortgages, receipts, and correspondence. Documents span the period 1868 to 1926.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Brooklyn Society of the New Church property records, 1973.222, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

processinfo.head: Processing Information note
processinfo.p: Minimally processed to the collection level.

bioghist.head: Historical Note
bioghist.p: The Brooklyn Society of the New Church was a Swedenborgian church organized in the 1850s. In 1869, the church purchased land at Clark and Monroe Streets that had formerly belonged to the Universalist Church of the Restoration.
